bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Monroe County, named in honor of President James Monroe, was formed in 1799 from Greenbrier County, and in 1802 part of Botetourt County was added. Monroe County was one of the fifty western Virginia counties to form the state of West Virginia in 1863.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Claims, 1803-1806, of individuals and county officials owed money by the county and the Commonwealth.
